meanings.definition: To gain possession of something again.
meanings.sent1: After losing his favorite toy, Tim was happy to reacquire it.
meanings.sent2: She had to reacquire her umbrella from the lost and found.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to reacquire the same mouse toy multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The detective managed to reacquire the stolen painting after a long search.
meanings.sent5: The student had to reacquire his textbook before the exam.

meanings.definition: To obtain or regain possession of something.
meanings.sent1: The explorer had to reacquire his map to find his way back.
meanings.sent2: He needed to reacquire his passport before the trip.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful professor had to reacquire his misplaced glasses.
meanings.sent4: She tried to reacquire her lost memories through therapy.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to reacquire his strength after being sick.
